website_summaries.verdict: An affordable option that works similarly to expensive models. There isn't a better choice available that offers more for less.
pros: Convenient features like various brightness levels, streamlined design, and SOS function
cons: Battery operated, but only  requires 3 D batteries

customer_reviews.title: Not as advertized
customer_reviews.text: Have received 2 different lanterns and both were not the advertised model. It should have been the Siege streamlight with 540 lumens brightness. Instead it was 340 lumens which is 60% less bright. I explained the problem to Amazon and the next day delivered another one but it was also the older less powerful light. I found out from the answered questions that some vendors are shipping the older less powerful model. Amazon is aware of the problem now and they will check on it. After inspecting the lantern, I really liked it. Well built and compact but not what was advertised. Amazon was quick to process my returns.
customer_reviews.author: Bpago

customer_reviews.title: DOA
customer_reviews.text: This product was dead on arrival. Using perfectly good batteries I placed them correctly. Despite this the lantern would not turn on. Continuing to try to troubleshoot the situation gave no answer. I simply consider this a dud, something not even worth returning. Subsequently I got another lantern that actually works and is fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broke after a short fall
customer_reviews.text: I really loved this light and even bought another one! But I knocked it off the nightstand onto a carpeted floor and it won't work any more. Not dependable in the real world.
customer_reviews.author: lvk

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Well I live in Florida and just used this light due to power outage. So far this little light has been a lifesaver. For its compact size (slightly taller than a soda can) it put out really good light in its low setting. The medium and high also put out a lot of light as well. Highly recommend this light for anyone's camping or survival equipment
customer_reviews.author: Robert Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: kid proof
customer_reviews.text: awesome product. battery life is perfect. I use rechargeable batteries and get two -3 days easily with kids changing levels. dropping it, getting it wet by leaving in 16" of rain in 4 hours. throwing it, its survived everything!. use these for power failures as a normal adult it might last forever. WELL built and solid feeling. The push of a button red lighting is great as no lenses or parts can get lost. bright enough to lite a 350 sq area well on low setting. dont expect some daylight sodium type light but for a long run time this is perfect. set on bathroom counter and have good light to shower in power failure.
customer_reviews.author: Shane S.

customer_reviews.title: Good lantern but a few quarks
customer_reviews.text: I really like this lantern but I do have two complaints that I feel deserve a three star rating. 1. The top of the lanter does not extend out, almost creating an umbrella, far enough to shield the light from shining straight up into your eyes while you are walking with it. Traditional lanterns have this feature on the top but not this one. 2. The lantern has three brightness modes that you can cycle through, unfortunately the first mode is the brightest so upon turning the lantern on in the dark you again blind yourself rather then starting with the most dim mode first.
customer_reviews.author: alex

customer_reviews.title: Failed after very little use
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these in 2016. They are nice when they work. One of them leaked some kind of clear silicon like liquid that made it so it doesn't work; this was not a battery leak, but something from the Streamlight. With three good batteries (tested at 1.6v), either the light doesn't work, or it comes on low, and can't be shut off. Considering how much use I got out of these, they aren't worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Normally Silent Buyer

customer_reviews.title: They thought of everything
customer_reviews.text: You can really tell that they tested the heck out of this thing. Thought of every situation you could possibly need for it. I recently went camping and we we playing cards in the dark. I had the lantern on the table, but it didn't help seeing the cards, unless we laid them out on the table too. I was able to take the top off the lantern, turn it upside down, and hang it by the hook on the bottom on the ceiling of the tent. Everyone was impressed by how the lantern could "do it all".
customer_reviews.author: Chicken Bobo

customer_reviews.title: WELL WORTH THE INVESTMENT!
customer_reviews.text: I’m one of many that lost their electricity in California and my candles helped, but I didn’t feel safe walking around. So I went on Amazon and bought this lantern. The lantern is small , but mighty. The lantern has a sturdy base that can’t tip over easily. I was able to read my book by the light that illuminated from it, and carry it from room to room easily by the handle provided. It only takes two D batteries. Well worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: Gillian Dowling

customer_reviews.title: For the beer drinker who shines!
customer_reviews.text: After spending 6 hours trying to figure out where to screw in the propane canister, I sat by the fire and had some beers. Twelve beers later I grabbed this lantern thinking it was my thirteenth beer. The on button was perfectly positioned where I place and apply force with my beer drinking index finger. The light turned on! I celebrated! Way better than the wild fire I could have started!
customer_reviews.author: oldOtter

customer_reviews.title: A little deceiving, but it works
customer_reviews.text: This is a very little light, and it's major drawback is the frosted cover it has which diffuses the light greatly. For it size, as in many LED's, it is more than sufficient. I have lanterns stored in every room, and I have this in the Bathroom, (when power goesoff, it doesn't wait until you are next to a flashlight). I also have one in my car kit, because of it's size, with a regular LED flashlight. The price is high though for what it actually is. I have since found cheaper more attractive choices. If you do get one, it works fine as advertised, just know it is small.
customer_reviews.author: Canopus

customer_reviews.title: Expensive Little (as in tiny) Flashlight
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting a box that contained a lantern-type light that would light up a circumference of maybe 5'. The light barely extends one foot out. It did not come boxed (as pictured), but was in a small used plastic bag with holes and tossed into an Amazon mailer bag. That's it. Obviously had been a previously returned item. And, it arrived a day past promised delivery time. Should have bought local.
customer_reviews.author: justtrottin'through

customer_reviews.title: Small and not TOO bright. Works.
customer_reviews.text: For the price I was expecting something similar to the camping lantern that I already owned, but this is about 1/2 the size. It lights up, and is bright enough. I'm thinking I should have purchased another one like I already owned, but this little thing is fine. It is waterproof and heavy with the batteries. It has the ability to hang it several different ways, and you can change the light to a blinker, dim it, or an emergency light. I am editing my original review since it has been better than originally expected when I opened it and operated it.
customer_reviews.author: C. FryTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: awesome tiny powerhouse
customer_reviews.text: This lantern is excellent. I love how it incorporates so many ways to hang it (top hook, bottom carabiner, bottom magnet), though I use the first two almost exclusively. The 5 light mode are easy to cycle through, though the initial setting is the lowest mode (in either white or red, depending). It is also handy having the option of taking the diffuser shade off to use direct light. At the brightest setting, this is able to light up half of a typical car camping lot. Product is small and compact, batteries are easy to access and install. I would recommend this product and am on the precipice of ordering a second one
customer_reviews.author: christine

customer_reviews.title: Good Design, Spotty Quality Control, Great Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: I chose the yellow version for the added convenience of the magnetic base. When it arrived, one magnet was missing and the other one loose in the package. I expected better quality control from Streamlight. Very disappointing! UPDATE: December 11, 2017 - I really have to change my review. Streamlight got wind of this light's missing magnets and sent out another base to replace the faulty one. Streamlight stood behind their product and made it right! That's all anyone could ask. Very good customer service!!
customer_reviews.author: DBOPD

customer_reviews.title: Great in emergencies
customer_reviews.text: These flashlights are awesome. We’ve lost power at our house several times, and these have been a life saver. They can brighten an entire room on their own, the battery life is excellent, and the price is right. I would recommend these to anyone. They’ve saved us many times when our power has gone out.
customer_reviews.author: Charisse

customer_reviews.title: Can’t go wrong with a streamlight
customer_reviews.text: Amazing lantern so far! I really enjoy the variety of options in light settings. It can be very light or fairly dim depending on your needs. I also appreciate how rugged and waterproof this lantern is. This is helpful on my camping trips where I fish and kayak at night. It seems sturdy enough to last through a tough trip. The only downside is the weight due to the three D batteries. This makes the lantern much more heavy. This does not allow it to be a great lantern if you are looking to backpack but it could easily be strapped to the outside of the bag. Overall I am extremely happy with the quality and ruggedness.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Szat

customer_reviews.title: Love this light! The Best I've Ever Owned
customer_reviews.text: Wow, wow, wow. The quality of this light combined with its features and long battery life make it an absolute essential for anything and everything outdoors. And while it sits in the house it stays in the linen closet for an easy one-click light that completely illuminates the entire closet. I've trusted Streamlight with my life before with their firearm mounted lights and now I trust them at the campsite or in the boat or even in the house. Just purchase this, no questions. You'll be overjoyed I promise.
customer_reviews.author: Jay C.

customer_reviews.title: It lasts forever!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this lantern in March of 2018, for use during emergencies, and as of December of 2019 I have only needed to replace the batteries once. It also is quite durable, having survived it's share of bumps, and drops. My only serious complaint is that during the final weeks with the first set of batteries the blinking of the red low battery warning light was causing the lantern light to blink too. On the whole I am very happy with this lantern, and I definitely recommend it to others who may be interested.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Rollins

customer_reviews.title: The lantern uses LEDs and is D cell flashlight battery powered for long run time
customer_reviews.text: In Houston, Texas we do have power outages far more often than we like. We purchased the Streamlight lantern for just such occasions. Since it is a LED light the battery life is quite long. Also, since it uses regular D cell flashlight batteries it does not require a charger which won't work if the power is off. The easily selected three light levels makes it simple to pick the minimum amount of light needed for a particular task and extend the run time accordingly. As is the case with all Streamlight products the quality is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: S. McHugh

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect product
customer_reviews.text: Almost perfect product except that it starts on the brightest level instead of starting on the dimmest and allowing the user to cycle to brightest. That ruins night-vision instantly. The red LED is a good level at 10 lumens. They should include the glare shield with this model as well as a yellow version like the Super Siege. This can easily be 5 star product with a couple small tweaks!
customer_reviews.author: Mystery

customer_reviews.title: Siege 200 Lumen 3AA is larger and heavier than it needs to be.
customer_reviews.text: I got the yellow version to replace my trusty 4xAA RiverRock LED Lantern purchased from Target ~2005. Good Brighter LED and dimmable settings. More diffuse light. Bad Heavier empty. Heavier when including batteries even though there is one less battery. Larger diameter, but less batteries. Stupid useless red LED SOS feature. No red LED dimmer settings.
customer_reviews.author: gadgetmaster

customer_reviews.title: Was a good lantern until...
customer_reviews.text: I loved the lantern and its features but after two years with only occasional use (2-3 times a year) the lantern has developed a short which causes the white LEDs to turn off. I have to tap on the lantern to get it to come back on. Sometimes this works, sometimes it doesn't. It only happens on the white LED, not the red so I suspect it is a problem in the electronics, not the battery connections.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Kasso

customer_reviews.title: Storm Resistance Sold It
customer_reviews.text: This may be the only lantern on the market that rated water-resistant to IPX7. Anything less is worthless in my opinion. With the diffusor on, the light is good up to 15 feet away. The diffusor can be taken off, but I don't bother with that in the darkness and moreover you can end up losing parts. There are clips at the top and bottom, but I have yet to really find use for them.
customer_reviews.author: Eli

customer_reviews.title: Light, Bright and Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these in 2014 and use it every time i lose electricity (much too often). No electricity again for the past two days. I pulled it out (second time this year) and I realized that if I had two of these, I could go between my bedroom and living room and have some awesome lighting. I'm sure they would be more than perfect for those who enjoy camping. They really are light, bright and perfectly wonderful. I love them (and I rarely write reviews).
customer_reviews.author: Boceltic

customer_reviews.title: Great for a tent or emergency light.
customer_reviews.text: The lamp will work well in a tent or for a quick foray into the night for a little relief. It isn't overly bright so don't expect it to light up a camp site. I question the usefulness of the red light but my old eyes maybe aren't the best for a test. Can't make a personal comment on battery life but again, if used for the intended purpose I don't see why it would fall short. I am satisfied with the purchase and would buy another if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, Practical, Well-Designed Lantern
customer_reviews.text: I bought this lamp mainly to use as an emergency light source during power failures. It puts out a good, strong light on the high setting and I like the fact that it has multiple light settings, as it can be too bright on the high setting if one looks directly at the lamp shade. The multiple ways the light can be hung is super handy. The lamp is lightweight, but seems sturdy and very well built and designed. The batteries are easy to insert. I have not used the lamp long enough to be able to comment on the battery life. So far, I am extremely happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi

customer_reviews.title: Works well for FL power outages
customer_reviews.text: Wish we had this for IRMA! It wasn't supposed to hit our coast so we weren't as prepared as we should have been. We had $1 Wal-Mart flashlights for 3 weeks until they got our power back on. We got this shortly after IRMA and has come in handy during a number of regular thunderstorms here. Works well and is very bright, depending how you hold it, it kind of shines back in your eyes so we just taped a piece of paper to one side.
customer_reviews.author: MiSsA

customer_reviews.title: Great lantern - just add duck tape
customer_reviews.text: The issue is that I put a piece of duck tape over the button for using the red night light. Otherwise the green battery status light is brighter than the actual lantern and messes with night vision. Other than that, this is a very well-designed LED lantern.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Sedmak

customer_reviews.title: Streamlight 44943 Siege 200 Lumen Lantern
customer_reviews.text: After a year of using, it's been a perfect companion lighting the way when dog walking at night. Handles built in hook design will hang nicely from your waistband or a jacket pocket. Compact and useful for power outages. Magnets in the base stick to metal providing hands free option. Using 3 rechargable batteries to make this a winner lantern at my house.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Puts out great light
customer_reviews.text: We bought two of these to bring out to our small sheep barn on dark winter mornings/nights. These things put out enough light that we abandoned our plans to run electricity out there once we saw how well these work. Red light is a nice feature too if you don’t want to ruin your night-vision. The cases on these are sturdy too. I’ve dropped them both with no damage. I love them and would stick with this brand if I ever need more.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. & Mrs. Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Lighting for Home & Car
customer_reviews.text: I have used a couple of these and loved them while building a new home before electricity was installed. Since, I use one in my car. Recently, we had a major windstorm in Salt Lake City and I was happy to loan mine to my sister whose electricity was out for three days. She ordered three and we bought her older single neighbor one, as well. I love these!
customer_reviews.author: Janie QB

customer_reviews.title: Best camping light I have owned
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this light for a camping trip over the weekend. It worked great. I used the red light more than the white light. The red night does not destroy your night vision. When I turned the light on I was not blinded. When turned on the light on the red setting, I wasn't blinded. When I walked around I could see where I was going. I don't think I used the white light at all. I know the white light worked great. I red light feature on the light was great. Worth the money if you do not want to go blind at night.
customer_reviews.author: David S.

customer_reviews.title: Streamlight Quality at a Great price
customer_reviews.text: Very solid construction. It is smaller than expected but I consider this a plus. Have bought several battery operated lanterns over the years but this is the first one that is good enough to use in place of my faithful Coleman gas lantern. Note: The instructions are not in the package - the are located inside the battery compartment.
customer_reviews.author: CajunBlade

customer_reviews.title: Purchased for power outages
customer_reviews.text: used in a recent power outage ,havent had to replace batts yet and was used a lot . Everyone found it easy to use its compact and gave plenty of light .Best of all no strobing or flashing light modes to blind you or piss you off
customer_reviews.author: Allen C

customer_reviews.title: Sos red flashing is dim and useless.
customer_reviews.text: The red light SOS flashing brightness is a joke. Useless in an emergency. I returned them. Costco has a 3 pack of vaguely similar lamps that are MUCH better, for $20 for 3. Don’t buy this!
customer_reviews.author: LAguy

customer_reviews.title: You Can't Go Wrong With This Light
customer_reviews.text: I've had the 540 Lumen model now for several years, never had a lick of problems with. It puts out decent light on its highest setting, and more comfortable lighting at the lower settings. Honestly, there is nothing that I can complain about this light, even the battery usage is very good. You are foolish not to have this light or something like it around the house. A heck of a lot safer than candles. Great price, great product.
customer_reviews.author: moreld

customer_reviews.title: Nicely designed, bright and sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: Mine arrived in a padded envelope with no box or outer packaging. This appears to be the way the lantern is provided by the manufacturer. Anyway it is a well built little lantern. I got the D cell version and am using Energizer rechargeable batteries and it provides great light for such a small package. Two retractable carabiner clips food neatly away and a uniquely designed handle that can fit over a steel tube or 1x2 length of wood. Somebody put some thought into this lantern. I got it on sale for $20. Well worth that price.
customer_reviews.author: Chris M.

customer_reviews.title: It's as great as all Streamlight's other products
customer_reviews.text: This thing is bright, as in bright enough that I had to tell my daughter to put it on low power when camping as to not disturb others. We had to clean and muck horse stalls in the dark at this camp, and it was so handy to hang this on the stall wall and be able to see what you were doing. I have the penlights also and these are every bit as good and bright as they are, but in lantern form. I'd buy again if I needed a second one.
customer_reviews.author: Amy E

customer_reviews.title: I'm pretty brutal as far as reviews
customer_reviews.text: I'm pretty brutal as far as reviews. Quality is far beyond I've seen with it's competition. It is very obvious that someone with a brain engineered this device. It's plastic, but quality plastic, with well sealed gaskets to keep out water/moisture. Very bright with the option of three power settings to conserve light and energy, with a red tactical light or signal. Numerous hanging solutions, and the option to remove the frosted globe and hang upside down for bare light was another example of well-thought development. SOLID 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: THE KAISER

customer_reviews.title: Dependable Light for Me
customer_reviews.text: At age 89, I needed to retire my faithful camping light. Coleman NightSight twin tube fluorescent,, at least 20 years of service. Tent camping is a past joy. Now I need dependable light in the event of a power failure. The Siege is perfect for me. It is durably constructed, quality materials. Good grips for all needs including battery changes. It lights up a large room, no fumbling or need to carry. Options to hang upright or upside down. Small enough to keep bedside. I have not had it long enough to verify battery use, but with options to conserve, not much of a concern. I feel other owners with different needs will find it most satisfactory as well.
customer_reviews.author: Reetz from B'ham

customer_reviews.title: Amazing light!
customer_reviews.text: This lantern has become our new staple for camping as well as backyard after dark activities.It is bright without being blinding due to the frosted plastic cover. The battery life is great, I actually have left it on overnight on 2 occasions and still haven't had to replace the batteries yet. The red setting is also very convenient fro ambiance and bugs in the back yard. Compact size is great for travel, and we love that it is waterproof!
customer_reviews.author: HumanIcicle

customer_reviews.title: Great lantern
customer_reviews.text: Very bright clean white light on high. Medium and low are suitably lower. Easy to change D cell batteries (3) A real performer for camping or emergencies. Batteries last for many hours. Wish it had an ultra low pinhead led for night time bathroom guidance like a couple of the Colemans have.
customer_reviews.author: trutell

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: This worked very well indoors when my power went out. I preferred the way it lit a room to the lught it privided outside or in a tent, my friend's cheaper version seemed to be easier on the eyes outside, though this obviously did the trick, abd I love that it us waterproof. But especially love this for power at home.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wow what a great light
customer_reviews.text: We seem to have a lot of power outages and you can not read with candles. This was a great buy because you can see, it if very bright and we have used it so many times for other things like going under the house, fine detail reading. We use it several times a week for non power outage situations. This was one of my best purchases. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: pburns

customer_reviews.title: Great product for everyone
customer_reviews.text: I just received my new lantern yesterday since my last old 10 year lantern stopped working and it was not a stream light. This lantern is great bright, well constructed, and with many great features. The rubber protection to prevent damage if dropped is in all the right places. The lantern is even waterproof!! I’ve used stream light products for many years and they are great. I highly recommend every house has this lantern for everything from daily use camping and emergencies. Great product
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn Cannon

customer_reviews.title: These are the best of the best
customer_reviews.text: These are the best of the best. Super bright, long run time, multiple settings, easy to use, water proof, very durable, easy battery replacement ( I use NiMh rechargeables). What more could you ask for in a small, compact LED camping light?
customer_reviews.author: Rusty Bee

customer_reviews.title: Great for camping and for power outages
customer_reviews.text: I took this camping and it was perfect. We could hang it from the top of the tent as it wasn't too heavy, and the red mode helped save our night vision. The different brightness modes are very useful depending on the situation. We get occasional power outages at home, and this can easily light up a room when you don't want too many candles burning everywhere. It does seem to pull a lot of power on the top brightness, but I have never really needed to use it at that level, the dimmer settings have always been sufficient.
customer_reviews.author: mfrazier

customer_reviews.title: This will do just fine.
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for a simple, versatile, portable, long-lasting LED lantern, then look no further. For the sake of keeping this short, I'll say these few things about this lantern: It's small, but it's incredibly bright. It feels well made, not like some flimsy lantern that's going to break the first time out. Don't underestimate how useful the ability to take the top piece off and hang it from a tree is. The battery life really is as good as stated. I'd buy this again, and I've already recommended it to friends.
customer_reviews.author: J D Fridley

customer_reviews.title: Well done all around
customer_reviews.text: I have one each of the D cell and AA cell units. Fit and finish is excellent. In contrast to other brands the Streamlight is more durable as I have given some of the other brands away as gifts to my grand children to play with. Camping/hiking the Streamlight is the unit that will be working when you needed it most.
customer_reviews.author: Strontium90

customer_reviews.title: Works well so far
customer_reviews.text: Been using it a few camping trips and it is much more solid than the cheap chinese knock-offs. I have used streamlight flash lights for a number of years and have high expectations of their products and this seems up to what I expect so far.
customer_reviews.author: MattT

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Red and white light - very versatile! I'm an amateur astronomer and was looking for a red lantern for doing astronomy nights and outreach events. The red is pretty bright, almost too bright, but a very nice deep red. Bonus, once you switch it to red mode (by pressing & holding the on/off button), it will stay in red mode until you long-press again, so you don't have to cycle through red and white to turn it off. Perfect! Also, it has multiple ways to hang it - shorter hooks on the top and bottom, and a long handle on the top that folds down when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Molly Wakeling

customer_reviews.title: So good, I bought a second one
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect lantern. Easy to put the batteries in esp in the dark! It is bright, has a hook at the bottom that is dependable. I liked it so much, that I bought a second one!!!
customer_reviews.author: Nickson Kaigi

customer_reviews.title: They are perfect for camping
customer_reviews.text: I own 3 of these now, I have one on each level of the house. They are perfect for camping, outings when it will be dark, or for emergency lighting. The light output is good, and if you need more, Streamlight has an upgraded model that puts out a lot more light. My needs don't require blinding searchlight amounts of light in a lantern, so this one is better for my needs. Runtimes, especially on lower settings, are excellent. I replace the batteries in them once a year when I do the smoke alarms. Given the current pricing ($22ish?) I can see no reason not to order one or two, or maybe 3. Never know when it'll come in handy!
customer_reviews.author: Juan LaLuz

customer_reviews.title: Real-World Useful and Very Adaptable + Long Battery Life
customer_reviews.text: Solidly useful. We had 4 days without power and used the heck out of this lamp. The brightest setting allowed us to prepare meals and check on horses at night. While eating dinner, we'd set it to one of the lower settings. Then, when getting ready for bed, we set it the red, which was more restful and easy on the eyes. Haven't used it yet for camping, but I'm sure it will be way useful. By the way, I use rechargeable AA batteries in "D" cell adapters. After four solid evenings of use, it was still going strong...still going strong. Can't recommend this light enough!!!
customer_reviews.author: Angst

customer_reviews.title: kind of annoying. Regardless
customer_reviews.text: I don't want to reiterate too much of what people already said, but here are a few things I've noticed 1. I showered with the light, and there was water inside the diffuser. I don't think it entered the electronic circuit though. 2. The battery compartment's thread is in the same direction as the diffuser thread. As designed, when you try to twist off the diffuser, sometimes the battery compartment will be twisted open along with it, kind of annoying. Regardless, 5 star for an excellent product. I will buy again once I test out the brightness in the wilderness
customer_reviews.author: Leo Zhang

customer_reviews.title: Streamlight 44931 Siege Compact, Rugged 7.25" Hand Lantern
customer_reviews.text: I really like this lantern and bought several as gifts. The light is bright and has a flasher setting. I used one for a night light and it only lasted 2 weeks on constant all night usage. Now it only has one ring of light. I changed the batteries but the full light did not back on. They would be excellent for short period of time usage...power outages for a few hours, camping tent bed time, etc. I have 2 that has done the very same thing.....
customer_reviews.author: Marjo

customer_reviews.title: Good!
customer_reviews.text: I had thought I had reviewed this because of comments received....I love it because it's economical for what it is & does! I have the model with the magnet base, and for my preference, I should have gotten the model with no magnets to save weight for camping...Can't be beat!
customer_reviews.author: Paul Madib

customer_reviews.title: Love this lantern
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased the Streamlight 44931 Siege Compact lantern for a wilderness hunting trip. It replaced an old school CFL 8 cell lantern. The Streamlight is much smaller, lighter, has more features, is brighter and has longer battery life than its predecessor. It provided plenty of light to function in a 12 X 12 wall tent. I twisted the top off and hung it up to light the entire tent. I used it quite a bit with no noticeable battery loss. Great Purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Tony  S.

customer_reviews.title: Bright lights and batteries last a long time.
customer_reviews.text: I now have 2 of these lanterns because they are so handy. First off, if you are looking for direct lighting such as output from a flashlight this is not the light you want. I tried working on a car at night with this lantern and it was frustrating trying to see something. The frosted globe comes off revealing bright LED lights under a glass globe. I have used this on camping trips and they are bright and light up an area generally set for propane lanterns. When not being used on camping trips, one is stored at home and another in the Jeep. I would definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Nick7380

customer_reviews.title: This thing is cool. Works great, good quality.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this light. I have a couple of other Streamlight lights and they are all good quality. I camp with friends who own different types of lanterns, and we all like this one best.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Long Lasting, Emergency Light
customer_reviews.text: There are 5 settings—3 white, high,medium and low and 2 red, steady and SOS. The lower the setting, the longer the batteries last. In my experience, having lost power for 21 hours a day after receiving my order, medium white light is good for most everything and low white suffices when you don’t need bright light. Flashlights have their place, but this lantern is perfect when you need light and want a stable base and wide spread. It can also be hung.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela J. Peerce Landers

customer_reviews.title: This turned out to be better than I anticipated
customer_reviews.text: This turned out to be better than I anticipated. I like the three white light intensity settings. The red light makes a good roadside warning light as well as a wide area light for night vision/map reading. A nice compliment of small size, long battery life, and multiple intensity settings.Also, the alternate red light for night vision or safety warning. (The red light also has a S.O.S. flash setting.) The On-Off/setting button has a nifty color changing light to indicate the battery condition. There are more good features making this little powerhouse worth checking out.
customer_reviews.author: Mike W.

customer_reviews.title: It's so tiny.
customer_reviews.text: After reading all the reviews you would have thought this was the second coming. It's much smaller than I thought (about the size of a coke can). The illumination is nothing to write home about. Not sure what all the hoopla is about.
customer_reviews.author: Martinex

customer_reviews.title: Excellent and innovative build quality
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased three of these lanterns and all perform exactly as advertised. The construction is top quality. The design is innovative. My only concern is that one of the lanterns I received has a significantly higher Kelvin light color. So it appears that LED's are being sourced from multiple vendors. This makes tracking quality and durability significantly more challenging. Otherwise it would have been 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: R. Murray

customer_reviews.title: A good quality lantern
customer_reviews.text: We live in Florida and bought two of these lanterns for hurricane preparation. The lights are solid, reasonably bright and have a good battery life. On the brightest setting, they put out about the same amount of light as a 40 watt light bulb. I have found that the advertised battery life is pretty close to real use, but if you are using re-chargeable batteries make sure they are of good quality and fully charged.
customer_reviews.author: LisaB

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my BF. His hunting buddy had bought a streamlight and they feel that they are the best. However, he bought another light that looks quite similar and was about $10 cheaper, for his uncle. They seemed to perform about the same. My BF kept the Streamlight, bc he just feels better about it, but he’s brand loyal too.
customer_reviews.author: marci

customer_reviews.title: Great LED Lanterns!
customer_reviews.text: Yes, it costs >$30 compared to the $15 Cascade Mtn Tech Mini Lanterns BUT you get what you pay for. These Streamlights, IMHO are damn near bulletproof, max flexibility beau coup light. Water resistant (is anything really water "proof?"), hang 'em by the top, by the bottom, take off the globe for "undefused" light. We have them on hand for power outages and take them along glamping for outside light in the eve at out camp sight. We have not been disappointed by them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great personal lantern
customer_reviews.text: Great lantern though not bright enough to compete with a propane lantern. It'll light up a small table or is good enough for one or two people walking down a path. One small design flaw is that walking with it lantern style requires holding it just right to allow the top to shield the light from your eyes. Propane lanterns have a larger hat/umbrella piece at the top so it illuminates the path while not blinding you. For that reason I'm sticking with a flashlight for walking and instead use the lantern for the table. I've also found it useful around the house when fixing things where you need some extra light.
customer_reviews.author: Greg S.

customer_reviews.title: Great Lantern for both Car Camping or Home Emergincy
customer_reviews.text: The Streamlight Lantern was exactly as advertised - arrived quickly - was a good value. I was thinking of loaning my Granddaughter my old gas lantern for a camping trip. I decided the Streamlight Lantern might be a safer alternative and more trouble-free. This is a great product for car camping or a power emergency at your home. The LEDs are long lasting and you'll find the lantern runs many days on low power. There are multiple hanging options which are really handy around camp.
customer_reviews.author: Dale Kayser

customer_reviews.title: Very powerful light source.  Great Hurricane prep.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in preparation for the inevitable power loss FL sustained during Hurricane Irma. This was my favorite purchase. The light is powerful, well-constructed, and above all, battery-conscious. We used this for several hours as our primary light source and this thing has miles to go before the batteries will die. Taking D batteries is a bit rough on the wallet, but since it does not use many, it's not so bad.
customer_reviews.author: Drift in Progress

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Cute and compact. Will be used for fishing and backup when the power is out. Nice and sturdy frame. The light switch is good and logical. Bright, low, off. Press and hold for red: bright, flash, off. Press and hold for white. Finally, a company that makes a switch that is useful and not annoying! Thank you Streamlite!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Solid performance in a small package
customer_reviews.text: Streamlight makes great products. I own many of their flashlights for work and personal use. This lantern is ideal for those pesky power blackouts we all experience. This is well engineered from the small details like rubber base to prevent slipping to having carabineer clips on both the top and bottom to facilitate hanging the lantern. Brightness is good for a small sized unit. Highly recommend for the days when you need it, you'll be glad you have it.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick G Foo

customer_reviews.title: Most awesome Lantern
customer_reviews.text: This is arguably the best Lantern around. I live in the woods under sometimes extreme conditions. The price can't be beat. A lot of lanterns have a few features if Lucky. This Lantern has a lots of features. This Lantern is reliable and durable. It is as bright as it promised and the specifications match. There is a lot of misleading lanterns on the market. Lanterns that claim to do battle with the ultimate Darkness but in the end the candle wins. I have bought the smaller version it is just as equally awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Lone Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Great Lantern!
customer_reviews.text: Great Lantern! Well built and priced. I really enjoy the options of hanging the lantern depending on your needs. One thing I would recommend to Streamlight is to make it that when you turn the lantern back on, that it turns on to the last setting that you had turned it at when switched off. When you have turned off the lantern, you have to go through the settings (high,medium,low) again. Of course it isn't hard or time consuming to go through the high/medium/low settings but it would be a nice have. I wouldn't be giving it a 5 star rating if it was a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT IN EVERY WAY!
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with my purchase of 4 that I ordered 2 more, with 1 to be kept in the car. Living in Florida, these were ordered for power outages from hurricanes. Extremely well designed with every inch functional and sturdy. The ease of changing batteries and battery level light are much appreciated additions. Anyone who has ever owned similar lanterns knows that the run time is always going to be less than noted for whatever reason, this is a given. But he brightness and quality of the Streamlight makes it the best of the bunch.
customer_reviews.author: J. R. Beltran

customer_reviews.title: High Quality LED Lantern
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic lantern. Very bright and the multiple features are excellent. It's very obvious the engineers at Streamlight put a lot of thought into this lantern and packed it full of features to make it extremely versatile and durable. Money well spent. Buddy that was going camping bought one as soon as I shared the Amazon link before our camp trip because he was equally impressed. I almost wish there were an even lower light setting or a manual brightness adjustment (although I realize this would be very difficult electronically and cost prohibitive for an LED application). We kept both lanterns "burning" all night on low and it was more than enough light for our campfire purposes.
customer_reviews.author: DIY DadTop Contributor: Fishing

customer_reviews.title: Wow, Bright and Versatile
customer_reviews.text: Wow, this thing really exceeded expectations. I bought this for something to keep in the house incase the power goes out, i like the fact that it can be hung from a ceiling fan and light up a whole area....which i didn't truly believe when i ordered it, but after having received it, and actually shutting down all the lights, and turning it on, it works just as described. It is nice to know that if the power goes out and my wife and kids are home alone, i won't have to worry about them not being able to see.
customer_reviews.author: Dean

customer_reviews.title: Solidly made, puts out a strong light.
customer_reviews.text: You can literally light up and entire 12 x 15 room with this lantern; it has the same light output as a 60 or 75 watt bulb. There are also other light settings that consume less energy. It's perfect for camping and emergencies. The lantern is sturdy and versatile. Highly recommended for every household, for camping trips, bug-out bags, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Barrister

customer_reviews.title: I love the upside down hanging feature!
customer_reviews.text: It's a bit heavy, but nice and bright. The button shouldn't easily get pressed (turned on) by accident when packed - a personal peeve of mine. I do wish the light had some kind of light shade when it's doing the upside down hanging thing so it's not so 'in your eyes,' and I wish the dim version was dimmer to save battery life, but it's a great area light for, say, cooking. Rechargeable batteries (lithium ion or similar) would have been nice too...but it's still a great little light.
customer_reviews.author: bruce w.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I recently went through a tornado and was without electricity for 10 days. This was a savior. Very bright, versatile and handy.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne G. White

customer_reviews.title: A preppers dream
customer_reviews.text: This lantern is a preppers dream . Drop proof, waterproof , and fresh quality batteries will last nearly 300 hours with the lantern set on low. Even on low it lights up an entire room where you can see just fine in a long term emergency situation . I bought five of these babies for my long-term storage along with a couple hundred D batteries . You talk about a peace of mind for when the crap hits the fan... light will be everything !
customer_reviews.author: paul w nott

customer_reviews.title: GREAT compact lantern, for campground or home use.
customer_reviews.text: Serious light, it is not lightweight for hiking, as it uses 3 D batteries, but for car camping, household emergency, this is a really REALLY bright lantern, and it is very compact. Well engineered, and we all know stream light quality, This is no exception. It is too bright to get a decent photo. It has multiple settings, I just took photos of two.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Zombie Prepper

customer_reviews.title: GOOD LANTERN, GETS 16 HOURS ON BRIGHT WITH RECHARGEABLE BATTERIES.
customer_reviews.text: Got the siege lantern with red light option a few weeks ago. It lights up my living room pretty well in the dark. I also I ran 3 brand new fully charged high-end Powerex 11,000 mah rechargeable D cells in this lantern with the light set on Max. I got 16 hours before the indicator light turned red to show low batteries. If run to exhaustion I would have gotten more time from the batteries. It feels sturdy and seems well designed. Seems like not many products are well made anymore. This one seems high quality. I am not paid for this review nor did I get a free or discounted product for writing this review. My honest opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Denver MASSAGE THERAPIST

customer_reviews.title: Well made product , great features .
customer_reviews.text: This is a quality product . Sturdy, great functions that will come in handy for power outages and camping. After reading the reviews on other similar products I choose this lantern and can see I made a good one.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: I love this lantern.
customer_reviews.text: I love this very high quality and very functional battery powered lantern. I actually have two of them because I received the first one as a gift and loved it so much that I had to buy a second one. I have used them about 5 times out in the woods camping so far and they are awesome. I am not surprised really because Streamlight has a reputation for high quality portable lights. The fact that they are powered by 4 sized "D" batteries is just another big plus because they are very common and easy to find. Note: (I have ran these lanterns for hours and hours and have not had to replace the batteries yet)
customer_reviews.author: Oregon Outdoorsman

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Wow. I bought almost the exact same thing at BigLots before I went camping this year and it broke almost immediately. Frustrated, I ordered this one and I think this will go down as one of my essential camping tools that last me a long, long time. Bright light, functional handle, easy to change batteries... What more do you want? Oh yeah, QUALITY! This has that in spades. I mean, I'm not about to go chucking it around but by the feel of it there is not wiggle or rattle when you manipulate it and it just feels.. SOLID. Good investment - 10/10 would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Torrin P. Dalcassian

customer_reviews.title: Great lantern
customer_reviews.text: I have the AA and the D version of this lantern. Love both, I use rechargeable batteries in them and in the D lantern I actually use a Wallyshine AA to D adapters so I can use my AA recharables. Pro's - 3 Light settings, bright great to light up a room when the power is out, nice feel to it, rugged. Con's - The AA and D Lantern have different light settings, so one goes from Bright to light as you flight through, the other is reversed. It's a pain getting used to one and then flipping past the right setting on the other and having to flip through again.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Brennan

customer_reviews.title: Battery life and durability
customer_reviews.text: Cannot believe the battery life on this lantern! It is extremely dependable, rugged, and long lasting. Stream light hit a home run with this one! I have used it for several military field functions and continue to be impressed. The red light is my favorite feature. I’ve left this on the low light setting for over a week and it was still on when I returned.
customer_reviews.author: Shimmy

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: I read reviews here and ordered one Streamlight 44931 Seige lantern. I put good batteries in it and it works great! I showed it to my daughter and son in law and they like it too. As we all lose power on a regular basis and hurricanes are coming, I ordered four more. Good tip to keep batteries with the lantern but not installed. Scented candles are OK but an open flame is not too safe.
customer_reviews.author: Buzzard II

customer_reviews.title: This thing is a Tank!
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly, quick delivery and this thing is a beast. We’ve used all sorts of lights and lanterns for camping over the years. But this little guy (even the 3D cell model is compact for that much battery) is the one to rule them all. I held off on this for s year after a friend recommended it. Do yourself a favor and just pull the trigger, you won’t regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Carl S

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: These are kind of cool. On the expensive side ( hopefully the price as not gone up). Decent build quality, in Hard plastic and silicone rubber. Light runs a long time on three "d" cells. Harsh white light though, supposed to be very water resistant.
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: I have had mine for almost a year now and just used mine for a black out. It illuminated a fairly large, pitch black, room and was bright enough to keep kids calm. I’m actually clicking on this product because I’m ordering two more. Prior to the Black out I’ve used mine for a night lamp/reading light and for outdoor activities. Would give 5 star but I think the battery life is slightly overstated. Other than that, this product is all that it claims to be.
customer_reviews.author: AMViL

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for camping trips, but at home, I use it as a secondary bedside light all the time. Best of all, it has been unaffected by dropping it multiple times on hard floors and even being stepped on.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Bridgman

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Light!
customer_reviews.text: Bought my first lantern several months ago. I like the D cell version as it lasts a long time even on high and you don't need to worry about whether they are freshly charged. Since that purchase, I've picked up 4 more for power outages and 1 for a gift. They are great lanterns that put out plenty of light for extended periods of time during our frequent power outages here in Colorado. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Cofishman

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic quality light with quite a few surprising features
customer_reviews.text: Who knew a lantern could be so fully featured? It has three different white light settings, and if you push and hold the power button, you get a red solid or flashing light. You can remove the top and hand it upside down to use as an overhead light. It's tightly sealed (battery compartment and lantern lens). The build quality is great, but that's to be expected from Streamlight. I have multiple Streamlight flashlights (Stylus Pro, Polystylus, etc.) and I'm consistently impressed with the light quality, battery life, and build quality.
customer_reviews.author: masterhankshake

customer_reviews.title: Won’t turn on
customer_reviews.text: Light won’t even turn on. It’s very sad to send products that won’t work
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Excellent lantern beats everyone else. High quality materials.
customer_reviews.text: Not a lot to say about a light. It works very well. Lens-off and red filter features provide excellent flexibility. Hooks on top and bottom. Flat side edges prevent rolling away. Rubber bumper on base protects soft surfaces. Very well thought out. Get the smaller version, too!
customer_reviews.author: Eric Bero

customer_reviews.title: This Is The One.
customer_reviews.text: I cannot say enough good about this lantern. It is BRIGHT! More than enough light to fill our large Starcraft tent trailer (with slide out). Battery life is excellent. And it is built TOUGH. I would not worry about dropping this unless it was off a cliff. I love the handle a lot more than I thought I would. It makes carrying and hanging a breeze, and it folds conveniently away when not in use. It is a bit heavy, but that is mainly because of the three C batteries, and because it is so compact and solidly built. Great for camping, basement, attic, or outbuilding. Great for emergency preparedness. Great for a reading light. Just great.
customer_reviews.author: kinnybee

customer_reviews.title: I don't need a boob cancer reminder. Just sell me pink things.
customer_reviews.text: I don't want to be reminded of boob cancer all the damn time. I like pink. Every cancer surviver I know just wants to get on with their lives. I like pink. Stop making me think about cancer. I can't even scrape the cancer reminder off. Go away.
customer_reviews.author: Mad Midwest Maggie

product_meta.title: Streamlight 44931 Siege Compact, Cordless, 7.25" Alkaline Hand Lantern - Coyote - 540 Lumens
product_meta.description: Rugged, cordless, alkaline battery powered lantern provides 360° of soft, even light that illuminates a large area. Tough Polycarbonate thermoplastic construction with elastomer over mold. Rubber molded base provides stability on slippery or uneven surfaces. Four white C4 LEDs and one red LED. To change the beam color from white to red, or red to white. White Light: High for brightest light; 540 lumens; runs 30 hours. Medium for bright light and longer run times; 275 lumens; runs 70 hours. Low provides extended run times for when less light is needed; 55 lumens; runs 295 hours. Red LED (one red LED). Red LED High Steady (night vision preserving mode); 10 lumens; runs 235 hours. Flash SOS mode for emergency signaling; 10 lumens; runs 430 hours. Recessed power button prevents accidental actuation; Features battery level indicator. Battery level indicator changes from green, to yellow, to red, then to flashing red when batteries reach the end of their useable life. Uses three “D” cell alkaline batteries (sold separately); Keyed battery door facilitates battery replacement in the dark. Base Diameter: 3.80 in. (9.65cm); Height: 7.25 in (18.41 cm); Weight 1 lb 15.0 oz (878.83 grams) with batteries.
feature_bullets: Multiple Light Modes. White LED, Red LED
Night vision preserving mode extends run time for emergency preparedness
Incorporated D rings on top and bottom of lantern to hang it in either inverted or upright positions
Cover is removable to illuminate large areas
Uses three “D” cell alkaline batteries (sold separately). Keyed battery door facilitates battery replacement in the dark
IPX7 waterproof to 1m submersion; 2m impact resistance tested

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars2,664 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
